Detailed Description

Motion Rules are basically stores of numbers related to the movement of in-game objects (things like gravity, maximum run speed, etc.

). The main added functionality of this class over a dict is the ability to temporarily override values, apply multipliers, and the like.

def motionrules.MotionRules.addValue (   self,
  name,
  initialValue,
  clamp 
)

Add a value to our dicts, filed under the given name.

Parameters:
name The name of the value, for later retrieval.
initialValue The initial value. Must be a number.
clamp The maximum magnitude of the value. May be None, in which case the value is not clamped.
